A limited beta began on June 23, open only to 75,000 US, Israel & Brazil customers, with a Chinese beta opening in mid July, and a final release expected no later than September.<ref>http://www.neowin.net/news/main/09/06/18/microsoft-set-to-beta-microsoft-security-essentials-june-23></ref>
+
A limited beta began on June 23, open only to 75,000 US, Israel & Brazil customers, with a Chinese beta opening in mid July, however, only one day later, (June 24, 2009), the downloads are no longer accessible, and the website displays a message saying "We are not accepting additional participants at this time"<ref>http://www.microsoft.com/security_essentials/</ref>. A final release expected no later than September.<ref>http://www.neowin.net/news/main/09/06/18/microsoft-set-to-beta-microsoft-security-essentials-june-23></ref>
Morro's announcement, made on Tuesday, November 18, 2008, marked a change in Microsoft's PC security strategy. [[Windows Live OneCare]], the all-in-one service that Microsoft launched in May 2006, only managed to take 2% of the already clustered PC security market.<ref>{{cite news
